sub_topic: The construction of the Cantor set.
message_1: A cantor set is a fractal set obtained by repeatedly removing the middle third of a line segment. If the original line segment has a length of 9 units, what is the total length of the Cantor set after three iterations?
message_2:
After each iteration, we are left with 2/3 of the previous length. So, after three iterations, the total length of the Cantor set will be:

Original length * (2/3)^3 = 9 * (2/3)^3 = 9 * (8/27) = 9 * (0.2963) â‰ˆ 2.67 units.
